result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Covarrubias

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert Covarrubias in court.  Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. Continued 45 days to give defendant time to obtain attorney.
Status conference scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert Covarrubias in court.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. Motion for Appointment of Counsel and Financial Disclosure Statement -Denied. Defendant waives right to attorney, form filed.  Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert Covarrubias in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. Defendant needs to contact SPD. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.addlTxt: Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.C. dob 2-23-1983, G.C. dob 7-16-2004 or RESIDENCES. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Roberto Covarrubias in court, in custody by video. Right to attorney options form given, referred to SPD. Signature bond set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
